title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Dec. 24, 1894. Temporary Chapel for St. Hyacinth Church Consecrated

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Dec. 24, 1894. TEMPORARY CHAPEL FOR ST. HYACINTH CHURCH CONSECRATED

body.p: Consecration ceremonies of the temporary chapel of St. Hyacinth Church took place yesterday.
A number of Polish societies, including military groups, left St. Stanislaus Kostka Parish early to take part in the services. The choir also took part. All were in full dress.

Reverend Simon Kobrzynski officiated, after which Reverend John Piechowski, pastor of the new St. Hyacinth Parish, sang the first Mass. A sermon was delivered by Reverend Vincent Barzynski, pastor of St. Stanislaus Kostka Church.
All delegates of societies made contributions for the new chapel, as well as all others that took part in the affair.
Acknowledgment of the contributions will be made later in this newspaper.
